physical_examinations.vital_signs: Weight: 3555 g; Systolic ejection murmur present; Estimated respiratory rate: 80 to 85 breaths per minute
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Transient signs of mild respiratory distress (grunting); chest radiograph showed cardiomegaly

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Temperature: 37°C; Blood pressure: 74/46 mm Hg; Heart rate: 140 bpm; Respiratory rate: 40 breaths per minute; Oxygen saturation: 92%
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Infant in mild respiratory distress with pink skin; Auscultation showed symmetric scattered crackles and intercostal retractions; 3/6 systolic murmur heard best at the clavicular and left sternal border; Palpable spleen tip with soft abdomen, mild liver enlargement.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Temperature: 37.1°C; Blood pressure: 62/42 mm Hg; Heart rate: 168 bpm; Respiratory rate: 36 breaths per minute; Oxygen saturation: 99%
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Sclerae were icteric, skin jaundiced to lower thighs; 2/6 systolic ejection murmur; Palpable spleen tip, soft and moderately distended abdomen.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Abdominal distention was noted upon readmission after initial discharge.
